#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with NDP candidate Rick Morelli , Vaughan
#Text=Thursday , October 4 , 2007
#Text=Rick Morelli is running for the NDP in the Ontario provincial election , in the Vaughan riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I have decided to run in this election because of my growing concern over the lack of fairness toward working people shown by the McGuinty Liberals .
#Text=In my opinion , we need the restore the faith of people in government .
#Text=This can only be done by governing in a fair and just manner for all Ontarians .

#Text=The reason why I am running in the riding of Vaughan is because I have lived here for nine years , have two children attending school in the community and I co-own a local pharmacy , also located in the riding .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=At the age of 22 I was elected as a trustee on the Metro Separate School Board , where I served for one term .
#Text=I then worked for Minister Tony Silipo for two years in the Bob Rae NDP government .
#Text=I moved over to city politics by working as the executive assistant to Toronto City Councillor Maria Augimeri for six years .
#Text=I have spent the last eight years in retail pharmacy .
#Text=As a business owner , I am very aware of fiscal issues and responsibilities .
#Text=Managing a business requires you to do a lot with very little and to keep expenses as low as possible .
#Text=I believe this skill set will greatly help me as an MPP .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=The biggest challenge to me is the Liberal incumbent , Greg Sorbara , Minister of Finance .
#Text=This is due to his profile in the community .
#Text=I am the best candidate in my riding because I understand the concerns of the working people and seniors in this community .
#Text=I see them and talk to them everyday , and I understand why they are disappointed in the current McGuinty government .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The three most important issues in my riding are property tax reform , health care services and rapid transit .
#Text=I agree with these three points .
#Text=I would support the NDP position to reform the property tax system by up loading the download of services back to the province over a 10 year period and reforming how homes are assessed .
#Text=I would support the re-listing of services such as eye exams , physiotherapy and chiropractic care .
#Text=I would support the hiring of more nurses and provide real incentives to attract family doctors in Ontario .

#Text=As well , I support key initiatives to bring rapid transit into Vaughan and I would examine the most cost effective way of establishing a network of LRT lines throughout York Region in order to encourage people to leave their cars at home .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=The first order of business for the new government should be to raise the minimum wage to $10/hour .
#Text=No one should have a full time job and still have to live in poverty .
#Text=Allowing full time employees to make at least $20,000/year would be better than the current situation .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=Property tax levels in Vaughan are not at a fair level for the services we receive .
#Text=Many residents in Vaughan pay $4,000/year or more in property taxes .
#Text=Our municipality is growing and the province just does not provide enough in terms of assistance for the continual growth .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=The first thing the province must do is create the position of jobs commissioner in order to save the manufacturing jobs that are left in this province .
#Text=Under the McGuinty Liberal government we have seen 175,000 good manufacturing job leave Ontario .
#Text=Before we can look at creating new jobs , we must do what we can to protect the jobs that exist .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I support MMP .
#Text=I think that MMP would be good for the NDP .
#Text=Our party traditionally receives less seats in the house than we do votes on a percentage basis .
#Text=MMP would force minority governments to rule more responsibly and to work closer with other parties .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=The new media will note play a large role im my campaign but plays a very large and crucial role in the central party campaign .
#Text=I believe it is beneficial .
#Text=I can see the day when election signs and literature ( hard copy ) will not be necessary and most campaigning will be done via the " new media " .
